content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.120 - Executive order no. 120: establishing the task force on military bases in new york state

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the U.S. Department of Defense has begun the
process of reviewing the structure of the national military force and
developing goals in relation to existing military bases throughout the
country; WHEREAS, pursuant to the National Defense Authorization Act
for the current 2002 fiscal year, the Federal government will institute a round
of base closures and realignments in 2005; WHEREAS, military bases in New York State are critical to
the defense of the nation and freedom around the world, and serve as an
important source of economic stability and pride to the communities in which
they are located; WHEREAS, these military bases conduct a wide array of
operations involving the Air Force, Army, Navy and Marines, including the

National Guard and reservists; WHEREAS, local base support organizations in New York State
continue to work at the Federal, State and local levels to retain and expand

New York's military bases; WHEREAS, the State of New York must continue efforts to
retain and improve military installations in the State by working cooperatively
with local governments and local base support organizations in order to use
resources and provide support effectively and efficiently; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the Task Force on Military

Bases in New York State. I. Membership

The Task Force on Military Bases in New York State (Task

Force) shall consist of members who shall be appointed by, and serve at the
pleasure of, the Governor. Members of the Task Force shall serve personally or
through a designee and shall include: the Chairman and Commissioner of Empire

State Development Corporation, who shall serve as Chair; the Secretary of

State; the Adjutant General of the New York State Division of Military and

Naval Affairs; the Commissioner of the New York State Department of

Transportation; the Chairman of the New York State Power Authority; the

President of the New York State Energy Research Development Authority; the

Commissioner of the New York State Division of Housing and Community Renewal; the Chancellor of the State University of New York; the Executive Director of
the New York State Thruway Authority; the Commissioner of the Department of

Environmental Conservation; the President of the New York State Environmental

Facilities Corporation; the Director of the New York State Office for Federal

Affairs; the Superintendent of the New York State Police; the Executive

Director of the Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority; and such other
members as the Governor shall deem appropriate. The members of the Task Force
and/or their designees shall receive no compensation, but shall be entitled to
reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in connection with the
performance for their Task Force duties. II. Responsibilities and Powers
A. The Task Force shall: (1)
work cooperatively with local governments
and local base support organizations to identify ways in which support and
resources can be utilized for the retention of existing bases and for the
expansion of these facilities in the event of closures or consolidations
elsewhere; (2)
identify State
resources that can be utilized to aid military missions, improve base
operations and quality of life for military base personnel and their
dependents, in relation to: roads; air and water accessibility; research, testing, training, storage and other facilities; adult and child education; health care; industry and economic concerns; power and energy concerns; housing
and community development; environmental concerns; technology issues; and in
relation to any other issue deemed appropriate by the Chair of the Task

Force; (3)
consult with experts as
necessary and call upon any agency, department, office, division, or public
authority of this State to supply it with such data and other resources, personnel and assistance as the Task Force deems necessary to discharge the
responsibilities conferred upon it by this Order; (4)
provide periodic reports to the Governor
on any major actions or efforts to be undertaken by the Task Force and report
to the Secretary to the Governor on the status of all Task Force business and
initiatives; and
(5)
supply
relevant data and information to the Base Realignment and Closure Commission
and/or appropriate Federal officials indicating that military bases in New York

State are critical to the defense of the nation and serve as an important
source of economic stability and pride to the communities in which they are
located. III. Cooperation of State Agencies

Each agency, department, office, division, or public
authority of this State is hereby required to cooperate with the Task Force and
to furnish the Task Force with such information, personnel, and assistance as
the Task Force deems necessary to accomplish the purposes of this Order. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: June 21, 2002
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
